intro: Wissadula gymnanthemum, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its compact growth habit makes it suitable for rock gardens and as a container plant. The flowers, which range in color from white to pink, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
